Module kivakit.primitive.collections
Package com.telenav.kivakit.primitive.collections

Interface ShortCollection

All Superinterfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.numeric.Countable, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, ShortIterable, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.numeric.Sized
All Known Subinterfaces:
ShortList
All Known Implementing Classes:
ShortArray
public interface ShortCollection extends ShortIterable, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.numeric.Sized, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.NamedObject
A collection of primitive short values. All primitive collections have a name that can be retrieved with NamedObject.objectName() ()} and a size retrieved with Sized.size() and they can be emptied with clear(). Values in this collection can be iterated with an ShortIterator returned by the ShortIterable.iterator() method.

A null value can be assigned to the collection with nullShort() and a value can be tested for nullity with isNull(short). In the case where null values may not be desired, hasNullShort(boolean) can be used to designate that a collection has no null value and hasNullShort() will return true if the collection has a null value.

New values can be added with add(short), addAll(ShortCollection) and addAll(short[]) and removed with remove(short). In addition, Quantizable values can be added with addAll(List), where each value is quantized via Quantizable.quantum() before being added. Since many objects are quantizable, this method is especially useful.

Whether a given value or collection of values is in the collection can be determined with contains(short) and containsAll(ShortCollection).

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
See Also:
Named, Sized, ShortIterable, Quantizable
